lead_paragraph: A preservationist mourned an important building of the Harlem Renaissance and other sites that he said would surely have been preserved in another neighborhood.

headline.print_headline: Much to Save in Harlem, but Historic Preservation Lags
headline.main: Much to Save in Harlem, but Historic Preservation Lags, a Critic Says

snippet: A preservationist mourned an important building of the Harlem Renaissance and other sites that he said would surely have been preserved in another neighborhood.
abstract: Appraisal column; Michael Henry Adams, preservationist, historian and leader in effort to protect significant buildings in Harlem, is critical of Landmarks Preservation Commission's lagging efforts in neighborhood; Adams blames biases that he says view wealthy, white neighborhoods as more worthy of protection, while others point to lack of community engagement and power of developers.
